info.title: PostHog Node.js SDK
info.description: PostHog Node.js SDK allows you to capture events and send them to PostHog from your Node.js applications.

examples.name: Generated example for getLibraryId
examples.code:
// Generated example for getLibraryId
posthog.getLibraryId();

examples.name: Generated example for initializeContext
examples.code:
// Generated example for initializeContext
posthog.initializeContext();

functions.description: Initialize a new PostHog client instance.
functions.title: PostHog

examples.name: Basic initialization
With personal API key

functions.description: Create an alias to link two distinct IDs together.
functions.title: alias

examples.name: Link an anonymous user to an identified user

params.description: The alias data containing distinctId and alias
params.name: data

params.description: The alias data containing distinctId and alias

functions.description: Capture an event manually.

functions.description: Enable or disable debug logging.
functions.title: debug

examples.name: Enable debug logging
examples.code:
// Enable debug logging
client.debug(true)

examples.name: Disable debug logging
examples.code:
// Disable debug logging
client.debug(false)

functions.description: Get the payload for a feature flag.
functions.title: getFeatureFlagPayload

examples.name: Get payload for a feature flag
Get payload with specific match value
examples.code:
// Get payload with specific match value
const payload = await client.getFeatureFlagPayload('flag-key', 'user_123', 'variant-a')

examples.name: With groups and properties

params.description: Optional match value to get payload for
params.name: matchValue
options

functions.description: Get the result of evaluating a feature flag, including its value and payload. This is more efficient than calling getFeatureFlag and getFeatureFlagPayload separately when you need both.
functions.title: getFeatureFlagResult

examples.name: Get flag result
With groups and properties

params.name: options

functions.description: Get the library version from package.json.
functions.title: getLibraryVersion

examples.name: Get version

functions.description: Get a persisted property value from memory storage.
functions.title: getPersistedProperty

examples.name: Get user ID
examples.code:
// Get user ID
const userId = client.getPersistedProperty('userId')

examples.name: Get session ID
examples.code:
// Get session ID
const sessionId = client.getPersistedProperty('sessionId')

functions.title: getRemoteConfigPayload

examples.name: Get remote config payload

Update organization properties

functions.description: Check if local evaluation of feature flags is ready.
functions.title: isLocalEvaluationReady

examples.name: Check if ready

functions.description: Override feature flags locally. Useful for testing and local development. Overridden flags take precedence over both local evaluation and remote evaluation.
functions.title: overrideFeatureFlags

examples.name: Clear all overrides
Generated example for prepareEventMessage
examples.code:
// Generated example for prepareEventMessage
posthog.prepareEventMessage();

functions.description: Reload feature flag definitions from the server for local evaluation.
functions.title: reloadFeatureFlags

examples.name: Force reload of feature flags
Reload before checking a specific flag

functions.description: Set a persisted property value in memory storage.
functions.title: setPersistedProperty

examples.name: Set user ID
examples.code:
// Set user ID
client.setPersistedProperty('userId', 'user_123')

examples.name: Set session ID
examples.code:
// Set session ID
client.setPersistedProperty('sessionId', 'session_456')

params.description: The value to store (null to remove)
params.name: value

functions.description: Wait for local evaluation of feature flags to be ready.
functions.title: waitForLocalEvaluationReady

examples.name: Wait for local evaluation
Wait with custom timeout
examples.code:
// Wait with custom timeout
const isReady = await client.waitForLocalEvaluationReady(10000) // 10 seconds

functions.description: Run a function with specific context that will be applied to all events captured within that context. It propagates the context to all subsequent calls down the call stack. Context properties like tags and sessionId will be automatically attached to all events. By default, nested contexts inherit from parent contexts. Use `{ fresh: true }` to start with a clean context.
functions.title: withContext

params.description: Context data to apply (sessionId, distinctId, properties, enableExceptionAutocapture)
params.name: data

params.description: Function to run with the context
params.name: fn

params.description: Context options (fresh: true to start with clean context instead of inheriting)
params.name: options

properties.description: If true, replaces the current context entirely. If false, merges with the existing context (new values override existing ones).   false
properties.name: fresh
